title.rendered: 9 Best Sketch Courses to Take in 2023

content.rendered:
In this guide, I’ve picked the best online courses and tutorials to learn Sketch App for beginner and intermediate learners. Learn how to create design system with Sketch, prototype, design landing pages, mobile and web design from start to finish, and much more. This list was built from Class Central’s catalog of Sketch App courses, and selected according to a well-defined methodology that you can check below.

Here are my top picks:

Course Workload In Brief
1. Sketch for Beginners | FREE COURSE (Envato Tuts+) 2-3 hours Comprehensive free Sketch course for beginners
2. Sketch from A to Z (2022): Become an app designer (Udemy) 4-5 hours Complete sketch course for mobile app design from start to finish
3. UI UX Design Essentials: Create a Design System in Sketch (Udemy) 1-2 hours Create a system design with Sketch – free course
4. The Complete Sketch 5 Course – Design Apps & Websites 2020 (Udemy) 15 hours Learn UI/UX design with Sketch
5. Sketch App Basics: How to Design and Prototype Using Sketch (Skillshare) 1 hour Create a simple design and prototype in Sketch for beginners
6. How to Design High Converting Landing Pages in Sketch for Beginners (Skillshare) 1-2 hours Design landing pages combining design and business thinking with Sketch
7. Diseño de Interfaces con Sketch (Domestika) 1-2 hours All Sketch essentials (in Spanish)
8. Sketch for UX Design (LinkedIn Learning) 2-3 hours Learn the design process in Sketch for an example mobile app
9. Sketch Essential Training: The Basics (LinkedIn Learning) 2-3 hours Create web layouts for a responsive website with Sketch

What is Sketch?

Sketch is a vector graphics editor and prototyping macOS app where you can build wireframes, designs for web & mobile, and work collaboratively with developers and designers. For designers the workflow is intuitive as it follows the same principles as other design softwares such as: Adobe XD, Figma, InVision, and others.

For starters, Sketch has a limited 30-days free account which may be useful for learning and testing if this application is the best fit for your needs. Even though it has limitations, the 30-days free plan can lead you a long way if you are learning and testing this software.

Sketch has a wide range of applications and uses, from UI/UX mockup creation, to wireframing, vector art, and prototyping. This software is indeed powerful. Being built exclusively for macOS, it offers the following features as standard: Dark mode, customizable toolbars and shortcuts, RTL support, built-in spellcheck, local document editing, and pain-free offline access.

Course Ranking Methodology

I built this ranking following the now tried-and-tested methodology used in previous rankings (you can find them all here). It involves a three-step process:

  1. Research: I started by leveraging Class Central’s database with over 100K online courses and 200K reviews. Then, I made a preliminary selection of Sketch App courses by rating, reviews, and bookmarks.
  2. Evaluate: I read through reviews on Class Central, Reddit, and course providers to understand what other learners thought about each course and combined it with my own experience as a learner.
  3. Select: Well-made courses were picked if they presented valuable and engaging content and they have to fit in a set of criteria and be ranked accordingly: release date, comprehensive curriculum, selling price, ratings and enrollments.

Course Ranking Statistics

Here are some aggregate stats about the ranking:

  • 2 courses are Free and 7 are Paid.
  • 8 courses are in English, and 1 in Spanish with English subtitles.
  • 6 courses are beginner, 1 intermediate, and 2 are beginner and intermediate level.
  • The most featured provider is Udemy with 3 courses.
  • Together, they account for 164,051 enrollments and YouTube views.

1. Sketch for Beginners | FREE COURSE (Envato Tuts+)

My first pick for the best Sketch course is Sketch for Beginners | FREE COURSE with Adi.

Learn all the fundamentals in this free course by Envato Tuts+, with the design expert Adi. In this tutorial for beginners, you will learn everything you need to know about running Sketch, from mastering the interface to using Sketch Cloud. By following this course, you’ll have all you need to start your own design projects confidently. This course is for developers and designers who are already familiar with similar design softwares.

Like most of you, I’ve watched countless (or more) tutorials over the years. Wow, this is the gold standard. No nonsense – every word counted and was informative. Excellent presentation. Very high bar set here. And thanks to Envato for making this available as a December freebie. – Berman Branco Music, learner

What You’ll Learn

Some topics covered in this course:

  • Fundamentals (Pages and Artboards, Layers and Groups, Vectors and Shapes, Images and Text, Boolean Operators, and Layer resizing and Constraints);
  • Reusing Elements and Styles;
  • Prototyping in Sketch;
  • Collaboration;
  • Plugins and much more.

How You’ll Learn

In this course divided into 19 parts, you will learn by following along with the instructor. You can also download the source files provided by the instructor, or start a project from scratch.

Provider YouTube
Instructor(s) Adi from Envato Tuts+
Level Beginner
Workload 2-3 hours
Enrollments 37,141 views
Rating 893 thumbs up
Certificate Not Available

Fun Facts

  • Envato Tuts+ provides courses and tutorials for web designers. They have over 820k subscribers to their channel and daily post video tutorials.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

2. Sketch from A to Z (2022): Become an app designer (Udemy)

My second pick is for Sketch from A to Z (2022): Become an app designer with Joseph Angelo Todaro.

Comprehensive guide to using Sketch for designing mobile applications. Learn the essential principles and tools of Sketch, discover design techniques, implement UI best practices, and journey from concept to completion by creating a sample mobile application. The instructor is knowledgeable and clear, delivering engaging content. Perfect for inexperienced beginners and intermediates looking for ways to improve their workflow.

I was looking for a course to quickly give me a comprehensive overview of Sketch and this is perfect for just that. Very well presented and comprehensive. – Jorike L., learner

What You’ll Learn

  • Master Sketch to create a strong mobile app design from start to finish
  • Advanced techniques and shortcuts to design faster than most professionals
  • User interface design best practices to solve problems effectively
  • Know how to simplify visual information to clarify meaning and improve UX
  • Understand how to design for different device viewports
  • How to leverage tools to ensure pixel perfect design work
  • How to save tons of time by using shared styles, symbols, and libraries
  • How to export and hand off the assets developers need to build a real app
  • How a good UI (user interface) influences good UX (user experience)
  • Be a professional designer who creates better apps faster

How You’ll Learn

This course is divided into 12 modules and 60 bit-sized tutorials. You can follow along with the instructor using the 39 downloadable resources (provided in one zip file). Upon completion of this course you will receive a certificate. You can also get help from other learners and instructors via built-in discussion forum. By the end of this course, you will have built a sample User Interface for an iPhone music player app.

Provider Udemy
Instructor(s) Joseph Angelo Todaro
Level Beginner
Workload 4-5 hours
Enrollments 34,857
Rating 4.8 (9,617 ratings)
Certificate Available

Fun Facts

  • The instructor also has other free courses on YouTube with introductory material for this course: UI Design Deep Dives and Sketch from A to Z.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

3. UI UX Design Essentials: Create a Design System in Sketch (Udemy)

My third pick is for UI UX Design Essentials: Create a Design System in Sketch with Pierluigi Giglio.

In this free course, you will create a Design System from scratch with UI/UX Designer and specialist Pierluigi Giglio. If you already have some understanding of Sketch and basic design skills, this course will help you get up to speed by using design systems.

Great course and I loved the plugins that saved time. This course made it easy to build from scratch. – Yolanda J., learner

What You’ll Learn

  • Create a Design System in Sketch
  • Use Text and Color Styles in Sketch
  • How to Create Scalable Design Projects
  • Pros and Cons of a Design System
  • Advanced Sketch Design Workflows
  • Tips and Tricks for Design Systems

How You’ll Learn

In this course divided into 6 tutorials, you will follow along the instructions building your own design system. For this, you should have Sketch already installed on your computer.

Provider Udemy
Instructor(s) Pierluigi Giglio
Level Intermediate
Workload 1-2 hours
Enrollments 8,625
Rating 4.6 (57 ratings)
Certificate Not available

Fun Facts

  • Pierluigi Giglio has two other courses for beginners: Sketch App for Beginners: Step by Step Tutorial [2020 Updated] and Learn Sketch Essentials for UI/UX Design in Under 2 Hours.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

4. The Complete Sketch 5 Course – Design Apps & Websites 2020 (Udemy)

My fourth pick is for The Complete Sketch 5 Course – Design Apps & Websites 2020 with Rob Percival and Andrew Eddy.

This course is comprehensive with good examples to help you put each concept in practice. It also covers design good practices to create your projects. The only downside is that this course was last updated in april 2020, so some of the referred plugins are now unavailable.

This course needs to be updated and the sketch app used in this course is old, however this does not limit anyone and I feel like this is by far an amazing course. – Montell G., learner

What You’ll Learn

  • Master the number one platform in UI/UX design, Sketch.
  • Wireframe websites, mobile apps, and more.
  • Design Mobile Apps, Websites, Web Apps & More
  • Create a clickable prototype that looks and functions like the real deal.
  • Build a style guide to make sure everything you do stays on brand.
  • Approach product design from a complete Design System

How You’ll Learn

In this course divided into 15 modules and 138 bite-sized tutorials, you will learn how to design mobile apps and websites by following along the instructions with 13 downloadable resources.

Provider Udemy
Instructor(s) Rob Percival and Andrew Eddy
Level Beginner
Workload 15 hours
Enrollments 18,485
Rating 4.6 (4,009 ratings)
Certificate Available

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

5. Sketch App Basics: How to Design and Prototype Using Sketch (Skillshare)

My fifth pick is for Sketch App Basics: How to Design and Prototype Using Sketch with Anna Avetisyan.

In this course you will learn the very basics of Sketch by building a simple design and prototype from scratch. This is the perfect course for real beginners with no experience at all to have a complete project within an hour.

Absolutely amazing! After taking two other classes – this was the first one that gets right into it without confusing the beginner! She’s terrific – especially liked that she gave a tour of the tools and workspace before launching into the project! – Richard Smiraldi, learner

What You’ll Learn

  • Introduction
  • Your Class Project & Resources
  • Sketch Interface Walkthrough
  • Part 1: Designing The App Cover Page
  • Part 2: Designing The Sign Up Pages
  • Part 3: Designing The Final Page
  • Part 4: Prototyping
  • Final Thoughts

How You’ll Learn

In this course divided into 8 tutorials, you will learn by following along with the instructor. By the end of this course you will deliver your project containing: the cover or splash page of the app, sign up pages, and the main page that people see after signing up. You can check other students’ submitted projects and receive feedback for yours.

Provider Skillshare
Instructor(s) Anna Avetisyan
Level Beginner
Workload 1 hour
Enrollments 577
Rating 96% positive
Certificate Not available

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

6. How to Design High Converting Landing Pages in Sketch for Beginners (Skillshare)

My sixth pick is for How to Design High Converting Landing Pages in Sketch for Beginners.

Learn how to design high converting landing pages with Sketch by combining design and business thinking for both mobile and web. This course is specially designed for beginner and intermediate designers.

This is the exact kind of tutorial I’ve been looking for. It’s extraordinary because Daniel doesn’t design arbitrarily, he does so intentionally. I liked the fact that he mentioned the dimensions, distances and sizes of elements as he designs them relative to one another. This tutorial is worth much more than many others here. – Shamsudeen Badamasi, learner

What You’ll Learn

  • Elements of a successful landing page
  • Finding inspirations
  • Basics of using Sketch
  • Installing plugins
  • Creating color palette
  • Choosing fonts
  • Designing the landing page
  • Designing for mobile
  • Class project

How You’ll Learn

In this course divided into 12 tutorials, you will learn by following along with the instructor. By the end of this course you will deliver your final project, your landing page. You can check other students’ submitted projects and receive feedback for yours. There is also a downloadable resource with all class materials.

Provider Skillshare
Instructor(s) Daniel Korpai
Level Beginner
Workload 1-2 hours
Enrollments 2,266
Rating 98% positive (69 ratings)
Certificate Not Available

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

7. Diseño de Interfaces con Sketch (Domestika)

My seventh pick is for Diseño de Interfaces con Sketch.

This course is in Spanish with subtitles in English. In this course focused on covering all the essentials for creating your workflow from scratch in Sketch, you will learn how to design a mobile-first website that includes a home screen, and another with photos, lists, and real information.

It’s a good course for those who just want a quick introduction to the Sketch Interface! – Amanda Mandim, learner

What You’ll Learn

  • Getting to know Sketch: the basics, Plugins, Shapes, Texts, and Images.
  • Working with shapes and styles: Operations with forms, Vectors, Style Management, Groups and symbols.
  • Designing the interface: Artboards, Wireframes, Visual Design.
  • Exporting and sharing: Preparing the images, shared libraries.
  • Final project

How You’ll Learn

In this course divided into 19 tutorials, you will learn by following along with the instructor. By the end of this course you will deliver your final project, a mobile-first website that includes a home screen, and another with photos, lists, and real information. You can check other students’ submitted projects and receive feedback for yours. There are also 22 downloadable resources.

Provider Domestika
Instructor(s) Javier ‘Simón’ Cuello
Level Beginner
Workload 1-2 hours
Enrollments 3,376
Rating 95% positive (202 ratings)
Certificate Available

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

8. Sketch for UX Design (LinkedIn Learning)

My eight pick is for Sketch for UX Design with Shauna Bybee.

In this course, Shauna Bybee walks through the design process for an example mobile app, taking you step by step through each phase in the Sketch workflow. Learn how to create a wireframe to visualize your concept using the shape, text, and graphics tools; build reusable symbols, and incorporate styles and visual effects. Shauna then shows how to transform your design into a clickable prototype that can be viewed directly on a mobile device. Finally, learn how to export your assets and generate style guides and design systems to keep your products consistent and designs in sync.

What You’ll Learn

  • Navigating the canvas
  • Creating wireframes
  • Working with shapes, text, images, and masks
  • Managing layers
  • Creating and nesting symbols
  • Using the Vector tool
  • Extending Sketch with design plugins
  • Creating, sharing, and managing libraries
  • Prototyping
  • Collaborating with Sketch Cloud
  • Exporting assets
  • Creating style guides and design systems

How You’ll Learn

In this course divided into 39 tutorials, you will learn the fundamentals of Sketch starting from the very beginning learning how to navigate up to a finished design. Upon completion of this course, you will receive a certificate which can be uploaded to your LinkedIn profile.

Provider LinkedIn Learning
Instructor(s) Shauna Bybee
Level Beginner/Intermediate
Workload 2-3 hours
Enrollments 35,807
Rating 4.7 (193 ratings)
Certificate Available

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

9. Sketch Essential Training: The Basics (LinkedIn Learning)

My ninth pick is for Sketch Essential Training: The Basics with Chris Converse.

Follow along with Chris Converse and learn the ins and outs of the Sketch interface, and how to design modern user experiences with Sketch, starting with project setup and working through to interactive prototyping. Chris shows how to create custom shared libraries, draw icons, work with imagery and typography, and share your designs across the web using the Sketch Cloud service. Finally, see how to export your work for developers or project teams for integration into their workflows. By the end of the course, you’ll be able to use artboards, share libraries, draw icons, create prototypes, and export assets to high-definition PNGs, JPEGs, and PDFs.

Overall, very easy to follow. The workshop type resources are great to do side by side comparisons! On some portions it can be fast paced, but luckily you can pause and go back to information that may have been explained too quickly. I think I may have a different version of Sketch so not everything looks exactly the same, but very similar to the video teaching. – Amber Cheng, learner

What You’ll Learn

  • Adding a library to Sketch
  • Designing a search form
  • Drawing icons in Sketch
  • Working with fonts
  • Setting up an artboard for tablet screens
  • Using Sketch Mirror to preview your designs
  • Creating interactive prototypes
  • Exporting artboards and assets
  • Collaborating with Sketch Cloud

How You’ll Learn

In this course divided into 40 tutorials, you will learn by following along with the instructor. By the end of this course you will be creating web layouts for a responsive website, which will give you an opportunity to work with imagery and typography, create custom-shared libraries, and even draw some icons with the vector tools. There are also downloadable resources.

Provider LinkedIn Learning
Instructor(s) Chris Converse
Level Beginner/Intermediate
Workload 2-3 hours
Enrollments 22,917
Rating 4.6 (137 ratings)
Certificate Available

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.
